posts.name: Henrique de Sousa Neves
posts.cooked:
How to add the robot’s CAD to AdvantageScope? I’ve already checked all the documentation and couldn’t get it to work. The CAD is already in .glb format, I’ve created the necessary folder and the configuration file, but my robot doesn’t appear—only the KitBots do.

Do I need any specific code, or is there anything else I need to do besides following the video from team 6328? Please help me!

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: Can you share a screenshot of the folder and files you’ve set up in the user assets folder? It would also be helpful if you can upload a zip of that folder.

posts.name: David
posts.cooked: I believe you must have a file named “model.glb” and not “untitled.glb” How did you name your components? (file name)

posts.cooked: Can you schedule a meeting with our team this week, please? It’s been two days, and we haven’t been able to do it at all—we’ve tried everything.

posts.name: Graham Howard
posts.cooked: Is “Use Custom Assets Folder” checked in the AdvantageScope Help menu?

posts.cooked: I don’t utilize, I use Show Assets Folder

posts.name: Graham Howard
posts.cooked: You need to check that box.

posts.name: Graham Howard
posts.cooked: Oh, sorry, I misunderstood what you were saying, ignore me. That’s strange.

posts.name: Henrique de Sousa Neves
posts.cooked: Sorry, my English is not so good.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: Are you trying to use articulated components ? The config file that you shared declares three components, but you haven’t provided model files for them. If you aren’t trying to use components, you should set the components key in the config file to an empty array. If you are trying to use components, I would highly recommend exploring AdvantageScope’s support for 2D mechanisms on the 3D field instead.

posts.name: Henrique de Sousa Neves
posts.cooked: In our robot we use elevator, so I will need export the elevator separately?

posts.name: Henrique de Sousa Neves
posts.cooked: Even if I wasn’t going to move the elevator in the simulation, would I still need to declare it in mechanism2d? Because I just need to add our robot, and another thing that could be the issue is that I received the CAD in STL, and then I converted it directly to GLB. Is there any problem with that or not?
